subject: Re: Web Module (Was: Perl6 new features)
body:
At 6:37 PM +0100 6/21/07, Smylers wrote:
>Moritz Lenz writes:
>  > You could help by contributing some suggestions to what the new "Web"
>>  module should be able to do, and how so. Web is hopefully "CGI done
>>  right", and still in its early planning stage.
>
>Web module?  This is the first I've heard of it.  Where is it being
>planned, if not on this list?

It was being discussed on the perl6-users list, last year.  And see 
ext/Web/ in the Pugs repo.  Actually, see ext/HTTP/ first, since the 
2 come in a pair, as a result of said discussion, and have been in 
the Pugs repo since Feb 17th.  Actually, see 
http://svn.pugscode.org/pugs/ext/HTTP/docs/ first, which is a copy of 
the important emails by Juerd which the HTTP+Web were started from. 
-- Darren Duncan
